Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, wonderful location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Savaget
Reviews.Content: We are another couple in the group of 10 mentioned previously and I would agree with every sentiment of that review. The hotel is in the heart of Montmartre but set off the main streets and is wonderfully quiet. Our comfort room was a good size and beautifully decorated with a good sized bathroom. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as there are loads of lovely cafes with a few metres. The Moulin Rouge is a wonderful experience but I would also recommend the restaurant Le Basilic, great food at a great price and just a few minutes walk away. Thank you Vincent and all the staff at Le Relais, we can't praise you highly enough and we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Louise P
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend staying at Le Relais, Montmartre. We were a party of 10 and had booked 6 rooms. We were in Paris to celebrate my partners 40th birthday and prior to visiting, after contacting the hotel to see if they could arrange something special for my partner, we had our comfort room upgraded to the superior room. This room was excellent, very quiet and very well decorated. The rest of our party had booked comfort and standard rooms and all though they varied in size, again they were all very clean and well decorated. The hotel was well situated for the Moulin Rouge which took us only a couple of minutes to walk to for us to see the fantastic show. The nearby restaurants and bars and the walk to Sacre Coeur were not far at all. Finally, the service in the hotel was exceptional, especially Vincent, to whom nothing was too much trouble. If you want a small tradtional boutique hotel, Le Relais Montmarte is wonderful. If we come to Paris again we would stay here again without hesitation and I RECOMMEND it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Gardenenthusiast49
Reviews.Content: Room quite small but perfectly decorated with all you could want in but no coffee or tea making facilities (maybe not a French thing). Very clean with lovely helpful staff. Convenient for Sacre Coeur just a fifteen minute walk and with a metro station only 5 minutes away. The Montmatre cemetary is well worth a visit too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect no frills hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Betty&TC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights 1st to 4th March 2012. This charming small hotel is ideally situated in a quiet street about 500 yards from the metro station Blanche (opposite the Moulin Rouge) and minutes away from some of the best restaurants in the city. The rooms are small but adequate. The beds are comfortable and we slept extremely well with virtually no noise from the street outside. Bathrooms will be a shade tiny for some but they work. Breakfast is available in the hotel for €15 but why would you do that when the famous 'Amelie' cafe is only 150 yards away? The beauty and gorgeous views from the Sacre-Coeur terraces are only an easy 15 minutes walk away and you can avoid the steep climb by using the funicular. Alternatively you can catch the street train from opposite the Moulin Rouge and for €6 ride in comfort all the way to the top. It is impossible not to eat well in Monmartre but be warned the best restaurants are always full on Saturday nights unless you book well ahead. Our rate was €194 for the double bedded room 303. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “THE Best Location”
Reviews.Author: ravstereo
Reviews.Content: Great location in a great city. This hotel was all we needed for our stay. A little noisy but to be expected in such a central spot. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and lovely location...”
Reviews.Author: ENKCharleston
Reviews.Content: After seeing all the wonderful reviews about this hotel on Tripadvisor, I booked a room for Jan. 27-30. The location was perfect for my husband and I as I wanted to be close to the Basilique du Sacré-Cœur. The hotel was only 5 minutes from the Metro, a 10-15 minute walk from Basilique du Sacré-Cœur, 5 minutes from the Moulin Rouge, and surrounded by restaurants. Although we were so close to the Moulin Rouge, it was very quiet. It is out of way for the major tourist attractions in Paris (i.e. Eiffel Tower, Lourve, etc.); however it is a nice alternative. Montmartre is very lovely and Metro can have you at all the tourist attractions within minutes. The room we had was lovely. Not too small, but rather cozy. Bathroom was great and the bed very comfy. We really enjoyed ourselves here and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, friendly staff in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ultan M
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, friendly staff in an excellent location. Near moulin rouge and Blanche metro. Got a good deal when booked online. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Zorro
Reviews.Content: Le Relais Montmartre is an excellent choice if you want to locate your stay in Paris to this bohemic but charmy part of town. It is a cosy and clean hotell on a quiet side street just a few minutes walk from restaurants, communications and night life. To be a three star hotel in Montmartre it gives you an five star experience. Best of all the serviceminded staff. Good value for the money and free wifi included.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of charm and great location”
Reviews.Author: Glenis C
Reviews.Content: The main street of Pigalle is not the most attractive part of Paris, but just up the hill Montmartre is a wonderful suburb with lots of excellent local restaurants, spots and unique shopping. This hotel is tucked away in a side street, that gives it a quiet but central location. Our room (comfort) faced the street, which meant it had the afternoon sun but we weren't disturbed by street noise at any stage. The room was charming and comfortable, but like most european hotels there wasn't alot of floor space for two medium sized bags. The staff on reception were very helpful with directions and restaurant reservations. We only ate breakfast in the hotel once as it wasn't included in the room rate and we found we could get better value and choice at one of the many cafes on the streets nearby. Neither of the nearby metro stations were ideal to arrive at - like many in Paris the only access was up or down stairs, so if your luggage is heavy, it can be difficult. The area is always busy so we felt safe walking around quite late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: IzzieMurts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Relais Montmartre for two nights whilst on a weekend away. We found the hotel to be a great find. Just a short walk from Metro Blanche and in the heart of Montmartre we couldn't have asked for a better location. There are lots of cafes, restaurants, etc in the area and rather than spending the 13 euros on breakfast in the hotel, we grabbed croissants and coffees from the local boulongerie. The hotel is clean, quiet, friendly, good size rooms. We will definately recommend it and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, big rooms, good location.”
Reviews.Author: louise_ts
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet cobbled street but close to Blanche Metro station. It is great to get all around Paris and Montmatre is by far the prettiest place to stay. It has cobbled streets and cafes all around. . I booked a superior room via the French website, we stayed Mon until Thurs and I paid £170 a night. The room was basic but big and clean and nicely decorated. Vincent, who works at reception is well worth getting to know, he recommended some fantastic places to eat and drink and will guide you about where to go in Paris to get the best out of it. If you stay here I recommend the restaurant Chez toinette which is a 5/10 min walk away. Incredible food and really nice atmosphere and not a bad price either. The hotel offer a continental breakfast which we did not have on our stay. It is 13 euros. I don't know how good it is but there are plenty of places nearby to get breakfast. If I return to Paris i would definitely stay here again and would recommend others do the same. Beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for your money”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain5154
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel many ties on my business trips to Paris. Easy access by metro or by car (parking on the street can be an issue). Nice small hotel, comfortable, quiet, good AC, free WIFI. Prices are very reasonable. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Very nice neighborhood, many stores and good restaurants within five minutes walk. If you are a tourist you could not be closer to Montmartre and the Moulin Rouge. A few of the rooms are small, bathrooms are very nice. Breakfast is OK, but weather permitting I strongly suggest to walk around the corner and have breakfast on one of those nice Parisian cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PaulKenny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the lively area of Montmarte. The room was quite small but very well designed. The staff were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Content: Hotel is small, rooms are pretty and cleaned, service and staff are excellent. Good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “new to paris...”
Reviews.Author: katieandcompany
Reviews.Content: After driving the maze through Montmarte, seeing all the shops, cobbled streets and one ways, we felt like we'd gone down the rabbit hole and into paradise. The hotel is small and quiet, the rooms are so lovely, and the concierge knows Montmartre inside out. The rooms were clean, simple and country-french. The sitting room always has fresh flowers and lots of maps, magazines, design books. They were working on the interior courtyard which promises to be a beautiful place for tea or breakfast. And the crypt dining room is a must. We were so happy here, for 3 nights, we hardly wanted to leave. Not a luxury hotel, but clean, well-kept and quite lovely. Highly recommend. And, it's just around the corner from the Amelie cafe...

Reviews.Title: “A quaint hotel in the heart of Montmartre!”
Reviews.Author: Woodzette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our weekend in Paris at this quaint hotel in the heart of Montmarte. It was close to the Blanche metro station as well as all the sites and shops in this charming area of Paris. The rooms were a bit small as they typically are in Europe, but it was very comfortable. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RRLondra
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights before, sadly, having to shift to another hotel (the Grand Hotel Dore in southeast Paris, which was rubbish). The first interaction I had was with Vincent, and he immediately puts you at ease. Very friendly, and very informative. My room was small, which I knew before hand, but it was very clean. I asked for a quiet room, and that's what I got, for the most part. The only negative was that the heater/air con is silent, which meant you could hear everyone slamming doors and coming out of the nearby elevator. I'm sure some would see the silent ac/heater as a positive, but not for me. I'll just ask for a fan next time. The area is great, especially if you're a foodie. Step outside and within 10 yards you have so many good, casual eateries, bakeries, a fish monger, boucherie, you name it. Loved it. It was such a joy to wake up to that scene for the two days I was there. When I go back to Paris, I'd seriously consider coming back here, especially if going alone. It might be a little tight for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love it!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie24545
Reviews.Content: After much researching, we chose Le Relais Montmarte for the first leg of our honeymoon, and we were not disappointed. It fully lived up to our expectations and then some. As mentioned by others, Vincent was the definition of what a concierge should be. He went above and beyond to assist us in our quest to conquer Paris in a limited amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian hotel in Montmatre”
Reviews.Author: alistair1112
Reviews.Content: A fantastically priced, blissfully quiet and beautifully decorated hotel in the heart of Montmatre tucked away from the crowds. Close to Blanche metro, the Montmatre location cannot be beaten and in my expierience you will not find a cleaner, quieter or more comforable hotel in the whole of Paris. A delight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice refuge in busy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Sweetpea2529
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this is a very nice, well-run boutique hotel -- with nice extras like all the major international newspapers and a cosy living room-like lobby. The beds were excellent, the bathroom and amenities very nice, and the front desk very helpful when Vincent was on duty. We wouldn't opt to stay in Montmartre again, simply because it is less convenient than the Left Bank for the places we like to go. That said, it is a fun neighborhood, and we especially liked Coqulicot for breakfast, and visiting the churches of St Jean de Montmartre (just at the Abbesses Metro) and St Pierre (off Place du Tertre),inaddition to Sacre Coeur.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful neighborhood with great French feel.”
Reviews.Author: Emsizzy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to find and in a perfect little spot near shops, cafes, and the Metro. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was expensive but had a good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: MisterBespoke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 7 nights at the Relais and loved every minute of it. The location in funky, bohemian Montmarte was ideal because we were able to base ourselves in a real Paris neighborhood loaded with charm, yet still be in walking distance to the city's historic core. This is the place to stay if you are active and like to walk. If walking is a problem pass the Relais up or use public transit & taxis. The staff led by Vincent and Crystal absolutely made our stay. What wonderful English-speaking Parisians they are! Vincent is a gem of a man and incredibly helpful and generous with his local knowledge. I booked this hotel based upon a review from a TA member who said they had been to Paris 24 times and the Relais was the single best value for the money in all of Paris. I have only been to Paris twice, but I am a believer. The Montmartre neighborhood is loaded with charming bistros, cute boutiques and is well-situated on Paris' only real hill, with unforgettable views at the top. Our room was small but very tastefully done and worked perfectly for our needs. Very comfortable pillows and bedding. Awesome air-conditioning in the room. A perfect boutique hotel. I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in lively Montmatre”
Reviews.Author: BigC50
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night during the hottest October weekend on record. We arrived early on Saturday to drop off our bags and were delighted that our room was ready. On the 4th floor it was comfortable and well appointed with a spacious bathroom. The location is ideal for exploring Montmartre and there are two Metro stations nearby. The staff were all friendly and helpful. A lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay in Paris...!”
Reviews.Author: Wandzia22
Reviews.Content: With apologies for the delay in submitting this well-deserved praise... Our delightful stay at Le Relais Montmartre in early June of this year was a wonderful — and memorable — start to a much-anticipated holiday in France. Vincent, the hotel manager, and his staff could not have been more helpful, gracious or welcoming. My daughter was especially grateful that her room was ready when she and her boyfriend arrived at 7 am after a long flight from Sai Gon — just one of many "extra" things that Vincent kindly took care of for us. The hotel is in a wonderful part of Montmartre and within walking distance of Sacré Coeur as well as many excellent cafés, shops and patisseries. The staff was also great about making recommendations. We look forward to returning when we next visit Paris. And we won't hesitate to recommend the hotel highly to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for restaurants & metro”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirelass35
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, sweet little pink beamed room overlooking a courtyard. Mini bar but no tea/coffee making facilities. Close to three metro stops, Blanche, Pigalle and Abbesses. Friendly receptionist and a left luggage facility for the last day. The area is very close to Moulin Rouge but it still felt safe with young teenagers. We ate at restaurants in Place du Tertre (15 mins walk), a typically Parisian square next to the Sacre Coeur, which had a wonderful atmosphere on a nightime, the Place which is touristy has lots of artists and musicians. A piece of advice take a detailed street map and a torch on your first night out as it took us a long time to find the hotel again afterwards. We were out sighteeing from 8 till 8, so usually headed straight to the restaurants before returning to the hotel, if you are tired try getting off the Metro stop at Abbesses it is much higher up the hill then there is a short walk to the funicular up to Sacre Coeur and Place du Tertre.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: Sums_H
Reviews.Content: We would happily stay there again. We stayed in the superior room and it was spacious and comfotable. The location is great - close to transport and to various sites including the Moulin Rouge. No issues with safety.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed staying there”
Reviews.Author: anastasiaVancouver
Reviews.Content: It is well located on the bottom of Montmarte Hill, so whenever we want to walk up the hills to see the basilica of Sacre Coeur We could within 20 minutes of walking from the hotel. Also it is around the residential area, so there are a lot of good restaurants, cafes and supermarkets nearby. Very close to the metro, however, it was a bit further away from the Seine river and eiffel tower. The atmosphere and ambiance of the hotel is very cute and lovely, the rooms were very romantic and colorfully decorated with wood beams.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but depends on what you like”
Reviews.Author: soluta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 'boutique hotel' and was much smaller than I imagined, but thats my fault for not checking. The staff were friendly enough and the room was comfortable though as the hotel is in the middle of a narrow side street and my room at the front, I was directly overlooked by the houses opposite. My main gripe was the lack of food service. There is no restaurant or bar though they do operate a limited room service after 5pm. I arrived around 1pm and as I hadn't had lunch I asked if I could have a snack or sandwich but nothing was available until 5pm. I guess that as the hotel is in the centre of Montmarte they assume everyone will eat out during the day. From a business perspective it's OK with free wi-fi, if a little unreliable. If you are a tourist the location in Montmarte it is very good with easy access to many of the attractions. When I return again I will use a different hotel, only because I travel alone, so I like the extra facilities such as restaurant and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Swaggie
Reviews.Content: Le Relais is cute. Staff are very friendly and helpful, our room was spacious and clean and had all mod cons. Breakfast is in a delightful stone cellar. It's a short walk to two Metro stations, so you're never more than 30min, max, from all Paris's attractions. And Montmartre is bustling with life, good places to eat, and sights to see.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, spacious, great service”
Reviews.Author: cindisuetoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard rom for one night until we could move to an apartment in on Isle St. Louis. Although we were on the main floor just off the lobby and looking onto the inner courtyard our room had a 'buffer' door that did an excellent job of minimizing sound. The room was surprisingly spacious, the bathroom by Paris standards was huge, and the shower was excellent. There was a small bar fridge in the room, which was an unexpected bonusWe were close to restaurants, shopping, and the Metro. What made our short stay very special, however, was the service of the staff. They were gracious and welcoming and went to tremendous lengths to help a friend sort out a lost luggage problem even after we left. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a boutique hotel that offers great value and a "welcome home" feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: SkiCV
Reviews.Content: Cute rooms in this very French hotel on Montmatre. Short distance to the metro with quick access to all the main sites of Paris. Great cafes and bistros all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Room”
Reviews.Author: foodie491
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 505 (Superior Room). It was quiet and away from the other rooms. Very private. Hotel is in a good location for restaurants and shops, with several boulangeries nearby. Second stay here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place in the heart of Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: leftmyheartinbergen
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were clean, the staff were friendly and the location was great for our needs. Travellers who are new to Paris may prefer to stay somewhere closer to the centre, but we love Montmartre so it worked for us. The room was clean and had great furnishings. Unfortunately we did request a twin room but received a double, though this has happened in many places we have stayed so not a big surprise! It was a bit warm (unseasonal in Paris) but there is air-con so this was fine. One problem was the street noise - we woke up to the sound of the rubbish bins being cleared more than once during our four day stay. Having said that, the street is generally quiet. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near to everything very French!”
Reviews.Author: Maureen36
Reviews.Content: Just back after a romantic few days with Hubby.I booked the Hotel so i was hoping it was everything we wanted .It was ,near to all the sights lots of nice bars and restaurants,but very quiet.The Receptionist was great ,had lots of things to recommend doing while we where there.It was very clean ,we didnt eat breakfast in hotel because there was so many restaurants nearby. It was near the metro so it was great for getting to CDG airport.All in all a great Hotel not too expensive 300 euros for two for 2 nights in Paris ,cheaper for a smaller room

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy, convenient”
Reviews.Author: rm3033
Reviews.Content: Long weekend in Paris for a birthday. Picked this hotel on the basis of existing reviews and it was as expected. It is very clean and the room was comfortable; not huge, but not small either. There wasn't a great view from our third floor room, but it was just a place to sleep and did the job well. The staff were very courteous. their English was as good as my French (i.e. not very), but we managed to communicate effectively, if slightly laboriously. Location was convenient - metro about 400m. It's on a street up a bit of a hill, so bear that in mind if you have trouble walking uphill. There is a great place for breakfast just down the road. It was packed with locals and the food was great. Would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: MarspekDT
Reviews.Content: Two bad experiences with the maid service at this hotel. 1) The maid entered our hotel room in the afternoon without knocking, my husband and I were both unclothed, and the maid just stood in the entryway with the door open to the lobby, staring instead of retreating and shutting the door. 2) I left my empty wallet in the hotel room safe. When my husband and I returned from our outing, the safe was empty. I spoke to the management about my suspicion that the maid had taken my wallet (where else could it have gone?), and he dismissed me and refused to look into the matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: JUDITHbristol
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel and will be coming back. Rooms very clean and appear newly refurbished (with an old country style decor). Like all hotels in Paris rooms are small, but good use of space and compared with other hotels the room is spacious really. All staff were very friendly and in good location in a quiet sidestreet in Monmarte with lots of cute cafes, etc nearby. Only negative was the internet. It was fast but connection dropped every 15-20 mins for some reason. I understand other guests had similar issues. However, this isn;t enough to take away from the fact this is great value and having stayed in well over 50 hotels in PAris this is the best for its class.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute and clean”
Reviews.Author: Lovevacays
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is super tiny....but so is the rest of Europe. Once you get over that fact, this hotel is very adorable and cozy. Of course, cleanliness is #1 - and it was! The area was also perfect, especially for people who enjoy night life. After touring Paris all day we'd come back here at night and have a drink at one of the many still-open and crowded bars/cafes. It was fun and safe to walk around late at night. It's also close to Sacre Ocre (spelling??) and beautiful to walk to during the day as well, along with touring the Montmartre region. For the price, you can't go wrong. Just know your expectations - this is not the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect perch for first time trip to Paris - Mother & 16 year old daughter”
Reviews.Author: kinserkay
Reviews.Content: Took my 16 year old daughter on her first trip to Europe last June. First stop was London and then took Eurostar to Paris. Picked Hotel Le Relais based on Trip Advisor reviews and had a great experience. Customer Service: Friendly, helpful, polite. When we called from US to confirm Internet reservation, there had been a mixup and Hotel gave us a superior room for same price. Location: Charming picturesque Montmarte. Surrounded by street cafes, fruit shops, bakeries, small shops. Yet, hotel is on quiet side street. Felt very safe. Magic Montmarte Moments: Experienced 21 Juin La Fête de la Musique. Rainbow at Sacre du Coeur. Views from top of stairs in winding streets. Cemetaire du Montmarte. Food is great anywhere: Crepes, Monsieur de Croque, pommes du frites, wine, cafe du latte. Chocolat! Transportation: 1 block to Blanche Metro Stop. Took taxi from Gare du Nord to Hotel. Took taxi to airpport - expensive but worth it due to luggage. Room: Huge spacious bath. Charming room with windows overlooking rue Constance. In-room safe, mini-frig, tv. Free papers-magazines in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay this time round”
Reviews.Author: sophiesmith
Reviews.Content: As repeat guests of this hotel feel that standards have slipped since our last visit a few years ago.Our 'superior' room may have been slightly bigger but was looking rather shabby and in need of updating. This is a nice hotel in a great location but the owners need to spend money to replace stained carpets,worn bedspreads,curtains etc. Based on our recent stay would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place, just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: webcouw69
Reviews.Content: Checking out tripadvisor for affordable places to stay I noticed that good places were not coming that cheap in Paris. So I raised my budget from €100 to €150 per night and chose Le Relais de Montmartre for the good reviews. The Hotel delivered what we expected, easy check in, parking arranged for €17,50 a day on a 10 min walk in guarded parking garage ( make sure you buy the more than a day parking tickets at the beginning of your park). The room was very clean and decorated taste. Airco worked well. It was a little small though. In the morning the shower doesn't have a steady temperature, shower at another time was good though. Since the hotel is on a back street the room even while on the street site is very calm, that was very important. We didn't do the breakfast since we were mostly sleeping late, that's what you get with good beds in calm. cool rooms. Around the corner there are more than 10 breakfast places where you can get a breakfast for half the price but probably not so extensive. Restaurants, cafe's shops were all in minutes walking distance. The hotel is located approximately between Pigalle (with the moulin rouge) and Sacre Coeur Cathedral. The hotel staff was very helpful in explaining were to go and how to get there all in good english. At night we went to restaurants and of course we had to see the show in the Moulin rouge, champagne included. From former vacations with a girl friend I learned NEVER take your girl to a to a cheap hotel, no matter how romantic the city is, sleeping with the flees in a bad bed on a dirty noisy room makes for months of quarreling instead of positive memories of great stay. So in short this was a great stay in perfect hotel. It was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: Malc65
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff very helpful/friendly. Hotel in quiet backstreet with short distance to metro,cafes etc. Try nearby cafe de Deux Moulins / the one if the film Amelie. Montmartre is good area to be away from the bustle/ noise of city centre yet easy to reach by metro (walk to Pigalle and then straight to Notre Dame very quickly eg). The (10 ticket carnet) can be bought on credit card as you leave the airport at the Tourist Info desk; some allow you to use the same ticket if used within 2 hours it seems? For a 65 yr old with one wife and one 20kg case the journey from Paris CDG airport was easiest/ cheapest by RER To gare du Nord and then bus 54 or 30 to Blanche then a few minutes walk up the hill to the hotel on the left/Easy! Cost about 20 euros whereas Taxi nearly 50 euros / shuttle about 35 euros so another option if you plan it 24 hours ahead? Booking a slot for the Eiffel Tower online is a good idea and saves quite a bit of queing / to go the the very top is only an extra 5 euros but be prepared to queue for an extra 30 / 50 minutes. Boat trips are all very much similar I found but the website Vedettes de Pont Neuf gets you an hour trip for 8 euros starting near Notre Dame. we liked the Latin Qtr as very lively but lots of meal choices / eat in daytime is better value(about 12 euros for 3 course) but we prefer to eat later. Coffees are expensive (up to 4 euros for a small latte type) but Mc Donalds on Champs Elysee was fine at about 1. 70 euros / we took a flask and amde up coffee at the hotel to ensure that we were not wasting money! The area below this hotel is a bit busy at night / Moulin Rouge, Follies Pigalle / sex shops etc but we never felt threatened even around 1am on returning one night. You should be warned about pickpockets at most attractions where there are lots of people but Paris is no different from any busy city / just do the obvious things! Hotels in Paris are not cheap but Le Relais Montmartre is the one that we would return to as long as you do not mind using the metro and that is easy with a bit of forethought and advise from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem....this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SXA
Reviews.Content: I don't often write glowing reviews about Hotels since there is always something to complain about, however I have to say this hotel exceeded all my expectations. After spending about 15 nights in hotels across Italy and having such a tough time booking a hotel in Paris, out of desperation I booked this hotel on Hotels.com since every other "recommended hotel by Rick Steves" was full. I was trying to find a hotels in the locations recommended by him and I am glad I was unsuccessful in finding a hotel in those areas since I would have never found this gem of a hotel or such a vibrant neighborhood of Montmartre. We arrived after midnight from Milan from the Gare De Lyon Train station by Taxi which was about 16 Euros at that time of night, and the person greeting us was very welcoming and gave us the keys and also the WI-FI userids and passwords for the two laptops we had. He even gave us a Ethernet cable since you could also use an Ethernet connection in the rooms. He even gave me an adapter since I could not find mine to fit the European style plugs. The room was very well appointed with a very comfortable bed and lots of electric outlets (which is useful if you have multiple things to charge). The bathroom was very nice with a very nice bathtub, separate area for the toilet and very nice toiletries. Plenty of hot water and good water pressure. The room air conditioning was excellent though we didn't use it much since it was on the cooler side in Paris. Though we were facing Rue Constance we hardly heard any noises during the night and hence had great uninterrupted sleep. Breakfast was not included in our room rate and we did not eat breakfast at the hotel, there are plenty of places within a block to eat as well. This is in the heart of Montmartre area, and about a few blocks to Moulan Rouge and the Blanche Metro Stop. Its also pretty close to Sacre-Couer. Though we had booked for 3 nights on hotels.com it appeared that the room was not available for the 3rd night due to a mix up and the hotel was arranging for us to stay at another place the 3rd night, fortunately they were able to accommodate us in the same room which was a relief. The staff spoke excellent English and were always available and friendly. It also surprised us that everyone we encountered in Paris spoke English to us while we attempted to speak our pathetic little French. The other feature we really liked was this was a non smoking hotel. All in all I highly recommend this hotel and it was truly a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great location!”
Reviews.Author: terryandhelen
Reviews.Content: Le Relais is in a trendy part of Montmartre with cafes, bars, restaurants and shops of every kind. It is a great area to explore. This delightful little hotel is only a couple of streets away from Moulin Rouge and 15 mins walk to Sacre Couer. If you are brave, you can negotiate the metro as the Blanche metro station is close to the hotel. The staff at the hotel went out of their way to assist with any enquiries we had. The rooms were beautifully appointed, clean and our comfort room was quite a good size, by French standards. If you need peace and quiet in order to have a good night's sleep, ask for a room away from the street. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as we preferred to find a little cafe; there are plenty to choose from. Free internet was available and a selection of travel books if you need one to help you explore Paris. We could recommend this hotel for your stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: Very clean and confortable hotel, close to the "Mulen Rouge" Our room was very small but in Paris it is quite common. The "Metro" is just two blocks far from the hotel and it can bring you everywhere you want in few min. Breackfast is quite expensive (13€/pers.) but you can easily find some beautifull bakeries

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Lovely Location, Surprisingly Quiet”
Reviews.Author: randy_be
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the recommendation of a friend for a business trip at the beginning of June 2010. This is a small boutique hotel a few blocks behind the Moulin Rouge. While that may not sound great to some, it is on a side street and is surprisingly quiet. Very nearby is Rue de Abbesses which is lined with street cafes. Around the corner is Café des Deux Moulins where Amelie was filmed. A 10 minute walk up the hill through lovely cobblestoned side streets will take you to Sacre Coeur. The rooms are not large but are very comfortable with a flat screen TV on the wall with many channel selections for a hotel. There was free WiFi which was a little spotty but it was free and worked well enough for what I needed. Breakfast is downstairs and was 13 Euros, convenient and pleasant. The room was spotless and well maintained with a comfortable bed, small desk with 2 chairs and 2 large windows that opened onto the street. While it may not be in the heart of the tourist destinations, it is certainly close enough with a Metro stop 2 blocks away (Blanche) while still out of the way enough to enjoy a little Parisian nightlife. I will certainly stay here again even when my work will book just about anything else in the city. Highly recommend you try this property. One final note, one evening as I returned, the gentleman at reception stopped another guest and advised him he had 2 packages. The other guest was a bit confused. The hotel had purchased flowers and champagne (at their expense) for the guest to give to his girlfriend to surprise her. The other guest was shocked to say the least. To me that is service!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive service at cancellation”
Reviews.Author: KarinDanmark
Reviews.Content: This is a sort of non-review :-) My husband and I had planned to visit Paris on April 16. 2010, and due to the vulcanic ashes closing the airports we had to cancel at very short notice. Le Relais refunded our deposit without us even asking and we look very much forward to actually staying in this hotel at a later time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClareandChris
Reviews.Content: The Relais Montmartre is an excellent hotel in a brilliant location - very close to the interesting shops and cafes of Rue Lepic and only steps from the Moulin Rouge (down the road) and Abbesses area (up the road). We travelled with my mother-in-law, this was her first visit to Paris for 60 years and she thoroughly enjoyed herself. Staff at the hotel were very welcoming and took time to look up information, particularly for our inquisitive mother. Rooms were scrupulously clean, with crisp bedding and fresh towels daily. The location of the rooms was exactly as requested with a ground floor room for mother, and an upper floor for us. Rooms were fairly spacious and well decorated. We heard nothing - not a car or motor scooter - silence in the middle of Paris! We took breakfast at local cafes which were very convenient. No real need to pay E13 each for this meal, but my guess is that if you did pay the breakfast would be fine. There is a little courtyard furnished in yellow, in which you could eat during the summer months and which looked very appealing. We would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family - we have been to Paris many times but this is definately the best hotel in the best location to date (and I guess that we won't be trying any more, the Relais Montmartre will do us fine in future! By the way, if you normally travel on the Metro try the bus for a change - get tickets as you travel over on Eurostar (books of 10 are sold on the train and can be used for buses and the metro whilst in Paris). The 95 bus from Rue de Clichy will take you on the tourist route via the Louvre and up into St. Germain de Pres - locally it is known as the tourist bus. We did push the boat out and spent an evening at the Moulin Rouge which was so enormously entertaining. Spectacular. Paris was wonderful - the people are welcoming, wine is excellent, and the cheese is to die for - try the little fromagerie opposite Rue Constance for a huge selection, you may even decide to bring some home, as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away in a lovely neighborhood, two minutes from metro”
Reviews.Author: RachelandDonny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in October 2008. The location is in a lovely neighborhood a couple of blocks behind the Moulin Rouge. It's not a particularly classy district, but we walked around many nights and never felt unsafe. We were surrounded by eateries and deli shops. The room was a decent size but the decor was very outdated. Also, the bathroom was a very good size, even by American hotel standards. The desk staff was excellent (and bilingual). They helped us print out boarding passes before we left. Expect a 20-30 minute drive to CDG if you take a shuttle, which the desk staff will also help reserve. Very close to a metro station, so you can get anywhere very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LuxembourgRow
Reviews.Content: Rooms small but quaint. Located in quiet street just off the bustling area of Montmartre. Very near metro stop. Great restaurants and cafés close by - try La famille and Un Zebre à Montmartre. Only down side was the used cotton bud and sweet wrappers in the wardrobe on arrival but this was swiftly cleaned up by the night receptionist. They let us leave our suitcases there on checkout day whilst we went visiting.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT THINGS IN SMALL PACKAGES”
Reviews.Author: glogirll
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, quaint , with great windows to fling open and view the ambience of Monmartre! The staff is faultess in insuring the guest's needs are met and make every effort to make you feel welcome. The antiquity of the hotel holds the visual charm, yet the needs of the 21st century traveler are prevalent... Great memory

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Beth_Knowles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem. It's location is fantastic, a beautiful, quiet street off bustling Rue Lepic, in the middle of charming Montmartre. The hotel is very clean, the staff very friendly and helpful and the rooms brilliant. Myself and my partner stayed here for 4 nights based on other Tripadvisor reviews and weren't disappointed. I can't think of anything remotely negative to say about Le Relais Montmartre, it really does deserve all of the praise given.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wowfactor
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel on the basis of trip advisor reviews and wasn't disappointed. It wasn't cheap (but that's probably the fault of the pound rather than the hotel) but it's in a great location - a really quiet street just round the corner from the bustling life of Montmartre and the Sacre Couer and a great selection of bars and restaurants. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Lots of hot water and helpful staff. The breakfast is only cold food and the room has some strange acoustics. It seems expensive at 13 euros but is ok when you see what else is on offer nearby. And yes the mini bar is very cheap! Would return if I came back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Mini bar cheaper than bars nearby”
Reviews.Author: LindaMSheffield
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well presented with clean, comfortable and quiet rooms. There was plenty of hot water for the shower. The staff were pleasant and helpful. It is an interesting area to stay in with good restaurants nearby, including Le Restaurant and the L'homme tranquil. The walking tour is worth doing. Unfortunately the Picasso museum is clsoed for rennovation until 2012. It was the first hotel where we found the mini bar to be cheaper than surrounding bars!

Reviews.Title: “Montmatre's hidden little secret”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleJoanne
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel 2 streets behind the Moulin Rouge/Blanche metro stop. Excellent reception staff who were very helpful. Clean, spaceous and nicely decorated rooms. Hot water at all times as well as heating/air con at all times. The only negative thing I have to mention is that the free internet/wifi was very very slow. The area is bussling with shops, cafes and restaurants all open until the early hours. Though the area had some late night establishments, I felt safe at all times and would certainly come back and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Parisien hotel experience I have had!”
Reviews.Author: PauaTas
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from this tripadvisor website. I have stayed in Paris on three occasions now and Le Relais Montmartre was by far and a way the best I have stayed at. It is what I think a Paris hotel should be like; boutique but well appointed, in a very French part of the city, close to the action but a street or two away from it so that you can sleep with the window open without suffering from street noise. The staff were excellent and the tariff was very reasonable by comparison to prices I have paid elsewhere in major European cities.

Reviews.Title: “BOOK THIS HOTEL FOR MONTMARTRE!”
Reviews.Author: hally12
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night short break in Paris, we booked with the Le Relais Montmartre, as friends were staying in Montmartre at The Mercure Ibis. I have a holiday accommodation in the UK, and I am very particular about cleanliness. I would have liked a four star hotel but Paris is truely expensive at the moment. This hotel is exactly as the promotional material states, both in writing and the photos. Rue Constance is like a little oasis in Paris, it is not rough at all, if you want rougher just walk for 5 minutes down to the Moulin Rouge! On arrival there is a staff member on reception, they were always friendly, the reception area is like a lovely lounge, with fresh roses, beautiful fabric and furniture, there is free internet and wifi. There is a lift or stairs, the rooms are very clean (slightly strong smell of air fresher) the bedding is spotless, i would not have a problem recommending this hotel to anyone. Its lovely. There is no pool or spa etc as its a smaller style boutique hotel, but it gives all we needed. Excellent location for everything in Montmartre, we recommend walking up to the little Vineyard (see map) . Overview - great hotel, definately book it!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and comfortable hotel in a quiet location in one of the most interesting areas of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: francophile061
Reviews.Content: A hotel that combines charm and traditonal French style with modern facilties such as air-conditioning. The rooms are comfortable, beautifully decorated and well-kept. The location is ideal: off the rue Lepic, busy with visitors and local residents and an easy walk from buses, the Metro and the well-known sites of Pigalle and Montmartre. Despite this, the hotel is quiet - particularly those rooms overlooking the internal courtyard. There is a pleasant lounge area on the ground floor, part of it outside. Reception is staffed 24 hours and English is spoken by the friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast is available, but there is no pressure to take it.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have chosen a better hotel for our trip”
Reviews.Author: KathyAnn50
Reviews.Content: Four of us were looking for a hotel for our two day trip to Paris. We chose Montmartre as it is a little bit away from the main city and tourist attractions but near Sacre Coeur. We arrived in the late afternoon feeling quite tired, so when we got off the Metro at Blanche in Boulevard de Clichy, right in the heart of the red light district, we wondered if we had made the right decision. However we walked along Rue Leipc and up the little side street where the Relais Montmartre is situated and felt a little better as once round the corner, it is a completely different world. When we got inside the hotel we realised it was a little gem. There is a beautifully decorated front lobby/lounge area and a small courtyard with seating outside. Our two rooms were quite small but perfectly formed with lovely fresh and tasteful decor, comfortable beds and superb shower rooms that had shaver points and hairdryers. We had chosen the 'cheapest' rooms in the hotel but got a peek at one of the larger rooms which looked quite a lot more spacious and equally as nice as ours. The only gripe perhaps was the price but then you pay for what you get. The staff we very friendly and accommodating, spoke good English and helped us sort out the right bus into the centre of the city. Going on the bus is a much better option than the metro. It's more pleasant generally and you get to see some sights along the way. Rue des Abbesses, just up the road from the hotel has countless bars, interesting shops and restaurants. We had a lot of fun walking up and down, browsing in the shops and stopping for coffee or a beer etc. It's far enough away from the Sacre Coeur area so you don't feel too crowded out by other tourists (go to Place du Tertre to have a look but don't stay too long). Everywhere we went we got a friendly welcome and we enjoyed a very nice lunch at 'A La Pomponette' in Rue Lepic. If you don't want to got too far afield to experience a French style Brasserie, try Brasserie Wepler, a five minute walk away on the very busy Place de Clichy, especially if you love seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: HMLBucks
Reviews.Content: What a lovely, charming hotel in a great area. Staff were polite and friendly and very helpful. Had a gorgeous room. Quiet too! Steps away from metro but lovely stroll into Montmartre. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: baddoffen
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with small rooms, but that's probably quite common if you want to live in Montmartre. This area is a good location with short distance to Sacre-Coeur, Moulin Rouge and a lot of small restaurants. The rest of the city is easy accessible by metro. Friendly staff and good service. Newly redecorated rooms and bathrooms, which are nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2London
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay here. The staff was very friendly and spoke excellent English. Our room was clean, quiet, and roomy enough for two. We did have breakfast downstairs one day. It was a bit expensive, but very convenient and everything was delicious. The only downside is that you are somewhat far from the major tourist attractions. The metro station is only a few blocks down the street however and there are several restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good location / above average”
Reviews.Author: edwis
Reviews.Content: This time we stayed in the Montmartre (18th) neighborhood, which is described as the “last village in Paris,” but is still full of tourists. Our hotel was about 3 blocks from the Moulin Rouge, near Rue Lepic (“a street that evokes old-time Paris”) and right off the Rue Des Abbesses, with its sidewalk cafes, shops and little parks. Since it was also Bastille Day, France's most important national holiday, we saw street musicians and events everywhere, including fireworks at midnight over the Eiffel Tower. Desk clerk was super helpful as needed. Breakfast go elsewhere for better and for much less. Superior room was just fine, super large bath area, nice amenities. streets get nicer around the corner and up the block for sure. would look for better value next time....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottL_London
Reviews.Content: The location is great - close to two metro stops on different lines. It's round the corner from Le Moulin Rouge, and just off the street that has the cafe from Amelie. There's plenty of shops, cafes and bistros very close to the hotel, including a brilliant Italian restaurant two streets away. We didn't try the breakfasts, as the local cafes and patisseries seemed cheaper. Our room was very nice, as was the bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the wireless internet works fine.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing”
Reviews.Author: Susannon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my daughter Catherine and it was excellent. It is a lovely hotel tucked away in a side street just off the main street in Monmartre. The staff are very friendly and helpful, let us leave our cases both arriving and departing and were great. The room was not huge, but hey, it is Paris, and the beds were wonderfully comfortable. The air con was quiet and very efficient and we had a lview over the street below from the doors that opened onto a Juliet balcony. It was the perfect place to stay, right in the middle of Paris and very near the Metro at Blanche and Abbesses, take your pick. The breakfast was OK, the usual continental assortment and the coffee was great. They also had hot milk, which I love with French coffee. Altogether it was a super place to stay, if not the cheapest. However, to be right in the middle of one of the capitals of the world is not going to be cheap, and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pipk
Reviews.Content: We had already had a month in Paris in an apartment and only needed a hotel for one night prior to departure. I had looked around at several hotels and thankfully came across Le Relais Montmartre. They were extremely accommodating, we asked them to store our bags for one week whilst we went to Italy which they did gladly. I felt bad about asking since we were only going to stay one night with them. The bags were in our room waiting when we returned to Paris. The hotel has lots of charm and character, the staff are very welcoming, friendly and helpful. We booked a superior room on which they gave us a very good price - even without us asking. The room was very comfortable, the most comfy bed for the whole trip! Lovely decoration, a bit English B and B style, the room was whisper quiet, it did face the inner courtyard rather than the street, but as the courtyard is big there was plenty of light in the room. The bathroom was a good size and there was a separate toilet (well at least the toilet was still in the main bathroom but there was a door) which was nice. The location is terrific, 5 mins from Blanche metro and just off rue Lepic which has loads of cafes and shops. We looked a couple of other hotels within the same price bracket and there was no comparison Le Relais won hands down. We would highly recommend this hotel, particularly for a shorter stay, say 1 - 5 nights. You may need a larger hotel for a longer time. The hotel had that lovely intimate feel, ideal for couples or a romantic weekend, or for a single traveller as the area is very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousTraveller66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights in this hotel, and enjoyed a lot. When we opened the door, Vincent already identified us and the check-in process was complete. The room may not be gorgeous, but just enough, and above all very clean. This hotel is located near to the two subway stations, and surrounded by a lot of cafes and restaurants. The cafe famous for the film "Amelie" is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, fabulous, perfect!”
Reviews.Author: VibsHarrison
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 5 night stay at Le Relais for our 1st wedding anniversary, based on the reviews on here and we weren't disappointed. Not in the slightest. Everything about our stay was perfect: the staff at the hotel, especially Vincent who recommended the most AMAZING Italian restaurant a few blocks from the hotel called Al Caratello; our room was beautifully kept - clean, spacious and quiet; the location was perfect and just a stone's throw from all the main attractions either by foot (Sacre Coeur) or a couple of stops on the Metro. My husband and I couldn't recommend Le Relais more highly. If you need a perfect hotel in a perfect location, then this is it! Our only negative experience was drinks at Le Chat Noir, a bar a couple of doors down from the Moulin Rouge in Montmartre. When my husband ordered a large (pint) beer and a lemonade the waiter arrived with 2 jugs each holding about 3 pints and a £35 bill!!!! When my husband queestioned the bill and the oversized measurements, the staff claimed to not speak enough English to understand us and so walked away £35 poorer and feeling like we'd been robbed. AVOID IT AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean and quiet, amidst the hustle of Montmartre. Steps from the Moulin Rouge & Sacre Coeur.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: A truly charming little hotel tucked into a small lane amidst the hustle and activity of the Montmartre neighborhood. Run by a pleasant and calming staff, the hotel is exceptionally quiet and clean, particularly for its neighborhood! Decorated in a style of old-fashioned elegance, including patterned wallpaper and exposed wooden beams. My room had wooden beams on the (low) ceiling and a rather large bed with paisley bedspread that gave the room a cozy feel. Outside, on the streets of Montmartre, you are mere steps from the world famous Moulin Rouge cabaret, a short climb up the hill to the white basilica of Sacre Coeur and amidst the heady nightlife and restaurants of Clichy, Pigalle, Blanche, etc. I spent my evening nearby with a bottle of wine and a crowd of Parisians being entertained on the steps below Sacre Coeur by troupe of African musicians. All of Paris spread out below under the slow light of sunset. The neighborhood is one of Paris' best. To be able to stay somewhere so clean, charming and pleasantly-run in the heart of Montmartre is a real pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: tristan118
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, excellent service, perfect location. I used to live in the neighbourhood for 10 years. This hotel is providing a quite place to sleep in a very busy part of Paris. Not that expensive compare with the so many average and expensive hotels in Montmartre...

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and friendliness in a great part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: WfromBRU
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend trip, that was mainly to enjoy the April end-of-the-season oysters at the Wepler restaurant on the nearby Place de Clichy. We secured the last available and probably the noisiest room in entire hotel - with two windows looking out right onto the sidewalk at street level (number 4). The room was beautifully furnished, perfectly clean, and isolated enough (with double doors to the lobby) so that noise was never a problem. Very friendly staff who immediately make you feel welcome. Fans of the film "Amélie" (le Déstin Fabuleux d'Amélie Poulain) will love this hotel, since it is just around the corner from the Café des Deux Moulins, the rue Lepic and other places featured in the film. A nice address to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jgk1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Relais Montmartre for 4 nights recently, and I don't think our stay could have been any better. The people working at the hotel are incredibly helpful, I would definitely take their restaurant recommendations over the recommendations from the guide books. The hotel is on a small side street, so it's relatively quiet in the room but takes no time at all to get to shops, restaurants and the metro. Relative to other European hotels I've stayed in, the rooms were a very nice size, especially the bathroom. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel, Great Neighborhood, No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: MoseyOn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely small hotel for six nights in March 2008. We were persuaded by TripAdvisor reviews, and were not disappointed. The double room was of about average size for Europe, but clean and comfortable. We were happy that the in-room internet access was trouble-free. The breakfast cost extra, but was tasty and filling. The neighborhood is fantastic, full of shops and restaurants, and well worth many leisurely strolls. If you do decide to leave the neighborhood (as we often did), it is a short walk to the metro station. The staff were friendly, and although we did not have many questions, they cheerfully provided information when needed. We made our reservations directly with the hotel, which means we probably paid more than we might have, but had no difficulties on check in. All in all, this was a very pleasant stay at a very pleasant hotel in a very pleasant neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressed as other reviewers”
Reviews.Author: JAV060
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on the reviews posted on trip advisor. Although found true for the most part, I did not find the hotel as impressive as it has been suggested. Be aware the brekafast is not included in the rate, we thought it was because of the way it as offered to us, but it was a terrible dissapointment having to pay 13 Euro/person/day for Corn Flakes and orange juice!! The staff is very helpful and warm, the lobby is cute. The rooms are tiny, tiny.. anyone with more than 2 suitcases will be in trouble. The room, at least the one I got, looked renovated, however the walls were peeling off, giving the look of a rundown place. We enjoyed the location, there are a lot of cabarets downhill, but the only reason to go that way is to take the subway, which got us to all of the attractions in a matter of minutes. The place to go is uphill, to enjoy the great atmosphere of Montmartre, full of great restaurants and galleries.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: horacethefrog
Reviews.Content: Found this place through Tripadvisor and we can see why it gets such great reviews. Reception is like walking into someone's rather nicely furnished living room and the staff are both friendly and efficient. We were surprised to discover that the hotel was refurbished a couple of years ago - the condition of the rooms indicates it was done yesterday. Everything was spotlessly clean and well maintained. Its location is great for Montmartre (obviously!), it's just a few minutes walk up the hill to the Sacre Coeur and the heart of Montmartre. If you enjoyed the film 'Amelie' you may be interested to find that the cafe in which Amelie was a waitress is just 100 metres or so from the hotel and it's just like it was in the film. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest neighborhood in the world!”
Reviews.Author: kmacirs
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel there just isn't enough room to write. And Montmarte!!! Had I known I would love this area so much, I would have booked a whole week here... When we arrived we were upgraded without asking for free. The room was HUGE and the bathroom larger than what some would expect in American hotels! Towels hung on heated racks! The staff was great (English speaking, too)... Thank you to Vincent who helped with dining suggestions, reservations, and plotting out sites on maps for us. Can't remember the street names, but when you leave the hotel, turn left and keep going up and up and up! Great boutiques, cafes, markets, and crepes! The whole area smelled like crepes! Please, please, please, skip the Moulin Rouge - it's the most expensive "Show Choir" concert I've been too. UGH. We will come back to this gem anytime we are in Paris (heck, we still have tons to come back to see) and refer anyone we know!!!

Reviews.Title: “Le Relais -great location!”
Reviews.Author: FraserFamilyCalgary
Reviews.Content: Montmartre is where you want to stay. Within minutes of this hotel, the Montmartre district awaits you. Cafes and bars abound. This hotel is a great price for Paris. The rooms were adequate and clean, the staff were very helpful. English was not a problem. The Metro and Opentour bus lines are just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in delightful Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: hoganhogan
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel. We had a superior room, which gave us more room than is usual in Paris hotel room. Beautifully furnished. Staff helpful. Great location for exploring Montmartre, and close to the metro for going further afield.

Reviews.Title: “The wonderful Le Relais Montmartre!”
Reviews.Author: Franshaw
Reviews.Content: This wonderful little hotel had been recommended to us and we were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel very welcome and the staff could not have been more helpful. Our room was beautifully furnished and wonderfully quiet. The bed was so comfortable, i slept better than I have done for many months! Our bathroom was small but perfectly adequate and the power shower was something else!! As the rest of the hotel, it was spotlessley clean and sparkled! The vaulted breakfast room is delightful - do try it rather than have breakfast in your room everyday! The food at breakfast is very fresh and of the highest quality, the staff very friendly and helpful. The charming recetion area is beautifully furnished and a very comfortable place to have a cup of tea after hard days sightseeing!! FS, Nottingham. FS, Nottingham We found it well situated for the metro and for evening strolls to the Place du Tertre and dinner. There is a real 'village' feel to it and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Suprised at the other reviews as I was left disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: TORN1
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in Paris at this hotel and can't say that I was impressed with it too much. Once we got to know the area we really did like the villiage atmosphere with the local Boulangerie, creperies and cafes. No complaints in relation to being in Montmartre as the area is quaint. Convenient to Metro Blanche and not too expensive by taxi at least to the Moulin Rouge then a quick walk up the hill. On first impression the lobby was very cute although my partner noted a smell of a hair salon perm treatment. I noticed it too and said it must just be some recent cleaning they have done although that smell greeted us everytime we were in any of the public areas in the hotel during our entire stay. Fortunately the smell didn't filter into the room if you laid a towel at the door. Noone could explain where the smell was coming from either which didn't help matters. The internet in the hotel lobby was not working either which was a little inconvenient as I do like to check email and update friends and family for a couple of minutes every few days whilst I am away. Some of the day staff offered the front desk computer although I never wished to imposs on them while they were trying to do thier job. The day staff all were pleasant, professional and amused me in my attempt to speak French to the best of my abilities. Most of our conversations where in English however. The room, on the first floor, was small but well laid out. I like the fact that we had two windows, one in the washroom that looked out onto a courtyard and one in the bedroom looking out onto the mainstreet with a view of other similiar buildings on Rue du Constance. We also had the hotel sign outside our window which fortunately wasn't lite at night. The bathroom was spacious with a good toilet and sink area. The bath/shower was elevated off the ground by about 6 inches which made it slippery and not easily accessible to get in and out of, especially as the floor was usually covered in water because the glass partition in the shower was not large enough to prevent the splashing from happening. The bathroom toiletries where pathtic and not to the standard of a room that cost 175 Euros per night. The night staff at the hotel, particularly the one young fellow who was on three of four nights (Oct 1, 2, 3) was absolutely unprofessional and left alot to be desired. He was downright rude and did his best to ignore us. On evening we came back to the hotel late and the hotel door was locked and noone was at the desk to answer the door. This is acceptable as I am sure he was in the washroom or doing otherwork elsewhere in the hotel. We waited less than a few minutes at the door and when he walked by he just turned the lock open on the door and walked to his computer and sat down without opeing the door for us or apologizing for the slight inconvenience of having to wait outside while he was doign his other work. This just left a bad taste in my mouth, let alone the perm smell was still everywhere in the hotel at the time. The day prior to departing I asked the front desk clerk to book us a taxi to Charles Du Gaulle Airport for our flight home the next day. He told me the taxi would cost between 50 - 60 Euros and it would be much cheaper and just as convenient for us to book a shuttle with the hotel. He said it would cost a 12 Euro booking fee to the hotel and then 26 Euro to the driver. We told him to make those arrangements and he said he would and then would leave a confirmation to be picked up at the desk when we come back to the hotel later in the night. Fortunately a new night clerk was on who was very pleasant and gave us the reciept and we paid him the 12 Euros booking fee. He explained our shuttle would be at 1030am instead of 1100am. The reservation stated we would pay the driver 28 Euros. This was 2 Euros more than what the front desk told us earlier in the day. No explanation could be given. Oh well, no worries! The next morning my partner and I came down at 1015am to check out of the hotel but low and behold the driver was already there. My partner and I put our bags down and paid the driver the 28 Euros as stated on our reservation. He picked up my partners bag and took it to the shuttle as I went and settled the bill for the room at the front desk. I saw the driver come into the hotel lobby three times and go back out to the car, assuming he took my luggage. The driver had parked the shuttle in the street and there were a few cars honking behind him so he spoke with the desk clerk and myself and said to hurry along and get into the shuttle. We end up leaving the hotel in a rush and on arrival at the airport I notice that the driver never took my bag from the hotel lobby. This clearly is partially my responsibility as I never double checked to see if my bag was in the shuttle or not but the driver also never picked my bags and hurried me along to get into the shuttle. The driver let me us his mobile and I called the hotel where they confirmed my bag was still in the lobby. The driver said he could call the head office to see if another shuttle could pick the luggage up and drop us off at the airport. This was too confusing though as we were pressed for time and I didn't want anymore confusion to occur. My partner and I had to take a taxi back to the hotel to retrieve the bag and then toke the taxi back to the hotel. This mistake cost as almost 80 Euro. The reason I am writing this parishuttle complaint under this hotel review, is that the taxi to the airport from the hotel would have cost under the 40 Euros we spent on the shuttle. The taxi cost 37 Euros from the Airport to the hotel. When I arrived at the hotel to pick my bag up I complained to the front desk clerk who originally told me a taxi to the airport would cost 50 -60 Euros. I told him that the taxi just cost us 37 Euro, cheaper than the shuttle and way cheaper than what he told us it would cost to go by taxi. I told him I thought he just wanted to make the 12 Euro booking fee by booking the shuttle and that because both myself and the driver were equally responsible for my bag being left behind that I wanted my booking fee back. We agreed on half of the booking fee which as a matter of principle. Overall the hotel is OK but in Paris there are nicer places to stay for that kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sydlon53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Relais Montmartre for three nights to celebrate our anniversary. Everything about this hotel was wonderful: the welcoming staff, the beautiful decor, the pristine rooms, the location (right in the thick of Montmartre) and the quietness of the room. The only thing that was missing was a kettle in the room (a minor detail given the amazing cafes and restaurants just down the road). We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbeck24
Reviews.Content: Le Relais Montmatre is a charming quiet hotel situated in a great area of Paris. We stayed for 4 nights for my girlfriends birthday, staff could not be more helpful and spoke perfect English. We booked a standard room which overlooked the courtyard, rooms very clean and nice touces. Shower/Toilet had nice toiletries but maybe a bit small for some. Hotel is situated in a perfect area for exploring Montmatre, 1 min walk from Moulin Rouge and Cafe Deux Moulin "Amelie". Rue Lepic and Rue Abbesses has some excellent cafes/restaurants. We also had dinner at Moulin De La Galette (Rue Lepic), which was fantastic and is definitely worth a visit. We decided to stay in Montmatre as on previous visits we stayed closer to the Seine. However with Pigalle subway station 5 mins walk it is easy to commute to other main tourist attractions in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “tres charmante”
Reviews.Author: txchic
Reviews.Content: Le Relais Montmartre is a charming, lovely, immaculate, little hotel. Our room was small and the bathroom with shower was tiny, but I had chosen the least expensive option. Nevertheless everything was clean, which is my first priority, and there was a nice assortment of personal toiletries as well. Evidently all the rooms are color coordinated and lavender dominated the color scheme in ours. The windows looked out onto a delightful little courtyard which was furnished with patio tables and chairs. The price of 147 euros did not include breakfast, which we could have purchased for 13 euros for a buffet breakfast, but my husband and I chose to walk to a local cafe for coffee and croissant. After two weeks in France we were worrying about how much weight we were gaining! I booked this hotel primarily for its location, two blocks away from the Moulin Rouge. This was our last night in France and I wanted to stay in an area close to the airport, but not at a hotel airport. Since we had not seen the Montmartre area I thought this was a perfect location. Little did I know that on the major boulevard on which the Moulin Rouge is located, there are sex shops of all sorts lining both sides. Sitting in the taxi as it wend its way through the streets, I wondered if I had made a mistake in booking the hotel, as the area seemed seedy, populated by questionable characters. But as it turned into Rue Constance I realized that as in many cities, nice neighborhoods are located right next to not-so-nice neighborhoods. The buildings adjoining the hotel were obviously well maintained and the streets were clean. As for the Moulin Rouge, we didn't bother going. The prices are outrageous. Back to Le Relais de Montmartre, this hotel was a great value, but if we had wanted to see all the sights of Paris, such as Arc de Triomphe, Tour Eiffel, Louvre, etc, we would have spent a lot of time and money taking the Metro or taxis from this part of town. Instead we stayed at a hotel on the Rive Gauche (see my review of the Hotel Millesime) on the first part of our trip and walked to all those destinations. I also believe the restaurants are better on the Rive Gauche. In the brochure for the hotel I noticed there is a website that has pictures of the rooms: http://www.relaismontmartre.fr/

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Le Relais Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: cantik1962
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel with great location. The staff were very friendly, spoke english proficiently, and were very helpful. My parties consist of female - my two daughters (22 years and 14 years old) and my friend with her daughter (14 years old) , we felt safe to walked around the neighbourhood at night after our evening meals. There alot of wonderful little restaurants and cafes around the area. There montmarte shoping/tourist area, beautiful Sacre Coeur, and lots of boutiques. The rooms were always clean, the bathrooms nice, and the bed are comfortable. Some morning we order the breakfast, there a choice of eating at the breakfast room down in the basement or brought to your room. The hotel room view looked out on to Rue Constance, a wonderful little slice of Parisian life. It's within walking distance of 2 metro stations (Blanch and Abbesses).

Reviews.Title: “In love love LOVE w/ this hotel”
Reviews.Author: millyt
Reviews.Content: me and my bf stayed here in june and we arrived early and were able to mkeep our luggage at the hotel as we looked around the neighbourhood and waited for the room to be ready. the staff is sweet and super helpful. the rooms are amazing new and extremely clean. the bed is soooo comfortable fell asleep right away. its quiet and everything i coukd hope for for my first trip to paris. i cant wait to go back. this hotel will be one of the best memories of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sezm79
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews here and I'm pleased to say we weren't disappointed. The hotel was lovely - clean, great location for restaurants, supermarkets (for cheaper beer and champagne to put in the minibar!) and also the metro, just down the road. Sacre Coeur is a short (uphill!) walk away too with fantastic views over the city. When we arrived Emmanuel wanted to give the room a last check before giving us the key and explained that he had to change a light bulb, which highlights to me a particular attention to detail. The room was a bit on the small size, but I'm sure its standard for Paris! The shower was really powerful - great! All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Island of cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: nishinshan
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be an island of cleanliness. Although Paris has some wonderful sites, in general I found the city to be crowded, dirty, and full of disturbing smells. It was nice to be able to come back to a hotel that was spotless and quiet. The staff are very accomodating and are able to communicate in English and other languages fairly well. Although the neighborhood of this hotel is not threatening in any way, you do have to pass through an area by the Moulin Rouge that is definately not appropriate for children. I would recommend this hotel for young single adults or married couples without children.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic All-Around”
Reviews.Author: GTAL78
Reviews.Content: One of the highlights of my three week visit in France. The Relais Montmartre was in a great location, the staff went above and beyond to be helpful and the rooms were impeccable. The only negative is the breakfast in the basement but you should be out at a boulangerie regardless.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, fab location near metro. Brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: gohop10
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. This is such a pretty hotel in a fab location. Down a side street away from noise and is residental so cheap supermarkets, fish stall. fruit and veg stalls on side streets. Staff were so friendly and free internet and receptionist printed off my boarding cards for my flight home for no charge. Rooms beautiful but we were upgraded to a comfort room which was so spacious and shower is strong. I couldnt complain about a thing and left money in safe on each of our 4 days with out problem. Didnt eat breakfast there so cant comment on that. Would definately go back. Photos dont even do it justice. A fantastic clean comfortable hotel in lovely location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent Parisian hideaway”
Reviews.Author: PaulCharles
Reviews.Content: I was guided by the previous positive reviews and they were spot on - a lovely little hotel, in a quiet pretty side-street with plenty of life in the vicinity and close to metro station. Charming room, very clean (so clean I slipped in the shiney bath and nearly killed myself, so take care). Staff speak good English and are very helpful. I'd happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: BCJay
