Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose Le Relais Montmartre after having done a lot of research on the internet. We stayed there for four nights in May 2008. In every way, Le Relais Montmartre was what we expected and hoped it would be. We will stay there again if we can. Check out their website. Read reviews of the place. Decide for yourself. We did and remain entirely satisfied with Le Relais Montmartre.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small boutique hotel near to the sites & metro.”
Reviews.Author: cabsavgirl
Reviews.Content: The rooms are individually fitted out - mine had pink beams. Hotel was spotless with helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoneStarHeaven
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Paris at the Le Relais Monmartre mainly for quicker access to Charles de Gaulle Airport the next morning. It is a beautiful hotel with very friendly staff. It is conveniently located to the Paris sites in the Monmartre area. They arranged shuttle service for us to the airport the next morning. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book anywhere else; this is the best hotel I've found in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ChangeGuru
Reviews.Content: What is it like? To compete in the city of style, any Parisian hotel worth its salt has to provide an impeccable experience, especially when they are so traditionally short on room space – which you can always overcome by spending many hundreds of Euros per night. For me though, like many modern travelers today fed up with the cold inhumanity of many expensive brand name establishments, I’m now happiest when I can stay in a personalized boutique property at a reasonable rate and especially when I discover a tucked-away, well-priced and wonderfully convenient gem such as this. Personal friendly service from the Manager/Concierge and an intimate country style feel in the furnishings and décor instantly make you feel at home. Where is it? In a quiet, almost village-like setting yet in the middle of downtown Montmartre on the Rue de la Constance, it’s just two or three minutes walk from the Moulin Rouge and the nearby Metro station this hotel is ideally situated for all of the delights of Paris, and most immediately La Butte Montmartre with its touristy artists, restaurants and bars and of course the famous Sacré Coeur, and its unbeatable Parisian evening skyline view. Rooms and Facilities Le Relais Montmartre is a 26 roomed property. The rooms are spread over several floors, and served by a small but quiet elevator. They come in three varieties and are all reasonable in size; the ‘standard’ rooms come with a full shower in the bathroom, ‘comfort’ rooms have a full bathroom and ‘superior’ have both a full bathroom and separate toilet. On the downside my wife felt the bathroom hairdryer was small and not very useful but the sheets, duvets and towels were thick and fluffy. Wooden beams across the rooflines, pieces of period antique furniture and delicate fabrics enhance the atmosphere of the rooms, although the beds, mini-bars, digital clock, room safe and flat screen TV’s are very modern. Free internet connectivity is an added touch, which simply requires a code to be entered into your laptop and is given by the manager on duty. The rooms either face the street (a quiet lane) or the interior courtyard and both are pleasant. Turn left out of the front door and twenty paces brings you to the heart of the Montmartre district. Restaurants, cafés and bistros abound; this is Paris at her best. We shopped for local camembert, bread rolls and bottled water and snacked on the best tasting supper ever to be eaten on a park bench! Vive la France! A continental breakfast is served in either your room or in one of two vaulted breakfast rooms, if desired and requested on check-in and there are drinks served in the summer on the small interior patio, with tea and coffee available in the downstairs lounge with its warming fireplace in the winter. Leisure Activities The local Metro station is one minute away and the open-top Parisian tour busses stop directly opposite its entrance. Sacré Coeur atop La Butte is a ten to fifteen minute gentle stroll uphill whilst the world famous Moulin Rouge is a two minute downhill walk. To describe this property as centrally situated in a fabulous tourist area simply wouldn’t do it justice; it really is in the perfect setting. Verdict? It’s outstanding and great value. We had booked a standard room at €155 which will comfortably accommodate two people although we were upgraded to a ‘comfort room’ at no extra charge on our first visit and without asking for it. (Normal cost €175). A superior room goes for €195. Breakfast is an additional €13 per person. We returned to the hotel for an additional night after a brief business trip to Hungary and were welcomed back as if we were long-lost friends; this time staying in a standard room facing the street which offered a fabulous local Parisian view – and was very quiet indeed. We promised to return – and meant it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: CeeJay51
Reviews.Content: The Relais Montmartre is a truly wonderful 'find' in Paris! Very reasonable and perfectly located for the Metro (Blanche), Moulin Rouge and Sacre Coeur - everything is a really short walk away. The staff are friendly and incredibly helpful and the hotel smells gorgeous!! We'll definitely go back there and have already recommended it to many people.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Jiggles
Reviews.Content: Small hotel set on a side street off Rue Lepic. Only a few minutes walk from Rue de Abessess where there are some lovely little cafes and shops of all descriptions. The staff at the hotel were helpful and pleasant, willing to speak English or French. The presentation within the shops in Paris never ceases to amaze me... I could stare at the displays for hours... second to none. Back to the hotel.... Positives: Exceptionally clean throughout. Quiet setting and no noise whatsoever from within the hotel. Minimal fuss at reception. who will also store luggage on your last day. Very handy for the Montmarte area, Sacre Couer and the metro. A lovely part of Paris. Negatives: Very narrow corridors and the elevator is a tight squeeze for two + luggage. No tea/coffee in room. Struggling to think of anything else! The exchange rate for pound to euro is very poor at present so this didn't help my perception of value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Do you like the movie Amélie?”
Reviews.Author: Denver_Mullican
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times in the past 12 months and highly recommend it. The location, in the heart of Montmartre and steps from Moulin Rouge is ideal. Two metro stations are a five-minute walk from the hotel. There are numerous stores and cafes, including two grocery stores, within a block. For those who like the movie Amélie, Café des 2 Moulins, where the movie is set is one block away. The rooms are beautifully decorated, clean and roomy. The front desk is extremely helpful and provides the level of service one would expect from a five star hotel. Denver Mullican

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Olofvilla
Reviews.Content: Very nice reception staff, very friendly and very helpful, helped with our o level French and helped accomodate friends who had been let down with a Hotel booking problem at another Hotel. Just to reiterate many reviews, very good standard rooms, comfy bed and flat screen TV, good size bathroom with bath and power shower,stayed for two nights Superior Double on 5th Floor, overlooking a quiet courtyard. I did not have the breakfast so cannot comment, there are cafe's and boulangeries very close by Be warned it has not got the facilities of the larger chain hotels, ie has a small reception area etc but the rooms cannot be faulted Great location just off Rue Lepic. Good area lots of nice bars & cafe's and only two minute walk up the hill from Blanche Metro station.Some will find Pigalle a bit seedy with lots of neon and sex shops by night but by day the area is very cosmopolitan. If only carrying light luggage well worth travelling from airport via RER to Gare de Nord and changing on metro to Blanche for only 8.5 euro's. I returned to the airport by taxi for less than 40 euro's Paris Visite card for 14 euro's was good value for zones 1-3 on metro - 48 hours use I will definitely stay here again for future trips to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Good to be in Montmartre again!!”
Reviews.Author: suzyHamptonCourt
Reviews.Content: Stayed in confort double. Quietly sited in Montmatre but close to all amenities. Exceptionally clean larger than average bathrooms for Paris, and very friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely stay there again. Susan and Patrick

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasaDub
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here over St Patricks weekend. Fantastic little hotel whcih is around the corner from the Sacre Couer and the Moulin Rouge. Good nightlife nearby and plenty of places to eat. Also a stroll from the metro station Blanche. The room was a superior room and was spacious and very quiet. The bathroom was slightly small but very clean. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. In the lobby they have magazines and books which you can take for the duration of your stay, some of which are Paris guidebooks and other items to flick through. We did not eat breakfast as there is a nice bakery around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: ReneeJ
Reviews.Content: Le Relais is a nice hotel to stay in for a long weekend. Our room was on the ground floor, just off the reception area. It was a good size, and the bathroom in particular was bigger than I expected: It was also scrupulously clean and very modern... the shower was lovely. The room itself was nicely decorated but not exceptional- but nice enough for a weekend. Again, very clean and comfortable. The reception staff speak excellent English, and although we didn't need to ask, gave the impression that they would be very helpful with any requests. The area is perfect for anyone who wants to be near bars and restaurants, but also wants their hotel to be a bit quieter at night. If you keep walking up the Rue Lepic (the road the hotel is off) you will find a long road with restaurants and bars on it which are a bit less touristy than the ones nearer the Moulin Rouge. Nearest tube is Blanche which is about ten minutes from Gare du Nord and takes about 20 mins to get to sights such as Eiffel Tower. I would recommend this hotel to pretty much anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great area, great city”
Reviews.Author: AB999
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to Paris and I am still buzzing. The Hotel Le Relais Montmartre is wonderful. I have read all the previous reviews and I didn't think that the hotel could live up to its billing. Well it did. The hotel is quaint (but not in a chintzy way), immaculately clean and superbly located. The staff are all extremely courteous and professional and are very willing to help in any way possible. The hotel is situated just a couple of minutes away from Rue le Pic and Rue des Abbesses, where there are dozens of cafes, bistros and wonderful shops. I particularly admire the way that the shops seem to take a great pride in displaying their goods, be it designer clothes, jewellery or basics such as bread or fruit. The bustle of Montmartre is only a stones throw away, yet the hotel is situated on a very quiet street and the Blanche Metro stop is only a leisurely 5 minutes walk away. Worth bearing in mind however is that if you get off the Metro at Abbesses, you should be prepared to walk up dozens of steps to ground level if you don't want to use the elevator. I would recommend going up to the Sacre Coeur at night, just to see a view of Paris at night. The Eiffel tower is constantly lit up during the hours of darkness, but on the hour, it twinkles for about 10 minutes. Paris is definately more expensive than other parts of France and it might be a good idea not to let it bother you too much if you want to make the most of your time there. Without doubt though, I would definately go back again and stay at the Le Relais de Montmartre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Adults2Kids
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel because the Terrass, which is just around the corner was full. It’s in a quite side road and is easy to miss, walking in is more like entering someone’s lounge, with the receptionist seated at a small writing desk is a room containing a few sofas and lined with book shelves. The Relais has the feel of a converted house with 6 or 7 rooms on each floor. The rooms are very recently decorated, clean modern, well equipped and large. I would say that they are to the same standard as the Terrass, which has 4 stars versus the Ralais’ 3. The real difference is in the public areas, the Ralais entrance lounge is its only area, it has no bar or restaurant. The continental breakfast was very good but bought to your room on a tray, but seemed expensive at 15 Euros. Overall the hotel was very good, and the service from the receptionist and other staff excellent. The only down side was that at 185 Euros a night, plus breakfast it seems a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cala81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all we could hope for. This was our first visit to Paris and we were not disappointed. Monmartre is a great area to stay in, it has an abundance of cafes and bistros and has a great atmosphere all day and night. The hotel room was immaculate and the staff were great. The hotel is situated very near a Metro station so it was very easy to sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: K_F_LA
Reviews.Content: Located on a delightfully quiet residential street a stone's throw from all the silly hubbub (Moulin Rouge) on Boulevard de Clichy. Charming beyond belief, spotless, and well-kept. Gracious and accommodating staff. Dainty lobby. Situated in the left ventricle of Montmartre, a short distance from Sacre-Coeur and all the cafes, bistros, and fromageries you could ever want. The Metro (Blanche) is two blocks down the hill. I saw two rooms here. One, overlooking Rue Constance, was quite tiny with nothing more than an 18 inch perimeter of floor around the bed. But the attention to detail was all there: gorgeous unfinished ceiling rafters; immaculate, top-of-the-line bathroom. Another room, a deluxe, (which I took, as it was given at the standard rate) was on the top floor in the back, away from the street. Quieter than a bank vault, its many windows overlook a courtyard. It is a good room in which to watch fascinating French public access and news programs until three in the morning while steadily demolishing mini-bar's cognac supply. Everything about this hotel was perfect. It comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Andytheknife
Reviews.Content: It was our first time visiting Paris and we couldn't have picked a more friendly and inviting hotel to explore the city from. The reception staff were very accomodating and were always on hand if you needed them. They also spoke very good English which is a bonus if you are a French language novice like i am! The hotel was impeccable clean throughout our stay. We had the breakfast on our day of departure which was also very good. The surrounding area of Montmartre is very picturesque and if you like venturing off the beaten track, there are many great places to eat and drink. We tried to avoid the obvious tourist traps but were stung once resulting in a fairly awful meal at The Crepery place in the centre of Montmartre! All in all, a great first stay in a marvellous hotel. We will definately be back to explore more of Paris and i wouldn't think of staying anywhere else but here!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: joannac
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, very clean, the rooms are decorated in quite a kitcsh style, which is cute. On the day were leaving, they very kindly let us keep our room beyond the check out time of 12. Which was really helpful as my boyfriend was ill at the time.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem”
Reviews.Author: Mallards
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights over New Year and would recommend it unreservedly. The owners have found the perfect balance of running the hotel in a highly professional yet friendly, helpful and intimate manner. There is great attention to detail and everything is spotlessly clean. The beautiful decor with top quality furnishings is a welcome change from most other boutique hotels today which end up feeling rather cold and charmless. The breakfasts were delivered to our room dead on time and were excellent quality and value. We're already looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicovico
Reviews.Content: Lovely romantic hotel - nice and clean - friendly and very helpfull staff. Okay location - excellent for our honeymoon.

HotelInfo.Name: Le Relais Montmartre
HotelInfo.Address: 6 rue Constance, 75018 Paris, France
